text: Bottle from Boxi-Späti - Clear dark brown color, beige head. taste is caramell, toffee, dark malts. floral hops. very well balanced. Full body. Good standard Dunkel.

Clear Ruby brown colour with beige head. Aroma malty and caramel. Taste nicely balanced, fruity, malty with Light hop Taste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle, 500 ml, from Pivoljub. Shared with JFK10000 and Max. Pours dark orange with large off-white head. Good lacing. Malty, caramel, light raisins, some smoke?. Light to medium sweetness. Medium- bodied. Solid.

500 ml bottle from restaurant Andechser in Mering close to Augsburg. Served in mug. Red brown colour, small head. Malt is dominating, a bit caramel. Malty and slightly bitter. Palatable and smooth Thin body, soft carbonated.

Hatalmas, tartós hab, sötétbarna szín. Karamelles, gyümölcsös illat. Édeskés karamelles, pörkölt malátás, gyümölcsös ízvilág. Könnyed, közepesen szénsavas, enyhén kesernyés. Jól csúszó, könnyed kis barna.

50cl bottle shared at home. Somewhat pale brown with a medium white soapy head. Light to medium body with moderate carbonation. Subtle bitter and sweet tones. Caramel, malts, grain and some dark fruit. OK brew.
Klares dunkelrotbraun mit durchschnittlicher Schaumkrone. Malzig, süßlich, Röstaromen, leicht würzig, sehr süffig.

Bottle. Red/copper coloured. Proper head. Aroma of red berries, malts and hops. Taste is malts, red berries, cherries, caramell and chocolate. Also some roasted flavours and some acidity. Medium carbonation. The abundance of aroma and taste reminds me of a Doppelbock. Very balanced. Full of flavour and super süffig at the same time. One of my alltime favourites.

9. 12. 2016, Ljubljana. Shared it with Sanja. Funny aftertaste, blunt thud stopper. Otherwise OK beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Quite nice german export beer, Tried in Poland the bottled version. Strong aroma and nice taste.
Clear dark copper, light brown lacing foam. Interesting mix of alt beer and dortmunder. Light caramel roasted aroma, somehow returning in taste. Bit strange. (Velp 201612)
Tap at Anno 1900, dark red-brown with a thin head, faint cocoa, sweetish, rich and malty.

From a bottle. Pours a dark copper colour with a thin head that disappears quite quickly. A sweet caramel aroma, medium sweet taste and quite easy to drink. I was in the brewery and they produce world class beer there, for my opinion this is not one of them but its still worth while trying and is still quality.
[backlog] 1-09-15 // at Retro Mainz. Brownish colour, beige head. Malty, some toffee, some chocolate, some nuts. Light herbs.

cold bottle at Beer Zone, it seems it was too cold and this is because there was no head.

Look: clear dark red, unstable brown head.

Aroma: malty, prunes, some ripe or rotten dark fruit.
Taste: moderate sweet, light acidity.
Flavour: toasted dark bread with prunes, fruity and malty.
Light spicy hops in the finish.

Very good.

Flasche 0,5l: Dunkles Mahagoni, ganz leichte Trübung, kräftiger stabiler feinporiger beiger Schaum; in der Nase kräftige Süße, Malz, Malzzucker, dunkles Karamell, eingelegte Früchte, Backpflaumen, leichte Röstaromen, Kaffee; im Körper kräftige Würze, Röstmalz, Malzzucker, Röstaromen, cremig, kräftige Kohlensäure, dunkle Fruchtigkeit, Holunder, angenehme trockene Bitterkeit, geröstetes Getreide; angenehmer trockener Nachgang mit Röstaromen

At Internationales Berliner Bierfestival 2016. 

Amber/brownish with a small firm head. Aroma and taste of malt, some nuts and chocolate. Quite refreshing.

On-tap at the brewery. Clear amber-brown with a nice stable head. Aroma is malty with notes of caramel, toffee and roasted malt. Sweet, malty, caramel,toasted bread, prunes and milk chocolate flavors. Medium-bodied, smooth. Nice Dunkel.
Dunkles braun schöner schaum, Geruch malzig würzig , Geschmack malzige röstaromen würzig leicht herb

Vom Flasche. Ruby cola brown minimal head. Almost slightly smoky rye bran bread aroma. Hint of caramelized sweetnessand cocoa. Fresh malts. Light body, top of the mouth sweetness, a little creamy. End is roasted malts and a little stickiness. Finish slowly fades and in the end its lightness is simply thirst quenching. Whats rad is this beer is a fine dunkel but not pushing anything more than it should. Low alcohol, tasty. A fantastic dunkel.

UPDATED: MAY 29, 2016 Bottle shared at home. Brown-dark amber colour with a small beige head. Nose is malty, taste is medium sweetness with malty flavours and light caramell. Nice but expected darker beer.

Clear, deep ruby colored, medium beige frothy head. Aroma is malty, Munich and caramel, bit nutty and some toast, some herbal notes. Taste is medium sweet malt, Munich, some caramel, toffee, toasted bread, light herbal bitterness, sweetish finish. Medium- bodied, soft carbonation, oily. Very nice Dunkel!
Garrafa de 50 cl consumida em casa. Âmbar com espuma média.Aroma a biscoito e malte. Doce sem ser enjoativa e com sabor a caramelo,algo de torrado e especiarias. Corpo médio.

Aroma:toffee, bread, some malt sweetness, herbal hop notes, some roastiness. 
Appearance: amber-brown, off white head, ok retention. 
Taste: toffee, bread, some roastiness, low herbal taste, chocolate, nutty, some sweetness. 
Palate: medium body, slick feel, average carbonation.
Overall: Well balanced, enjoyable.
Dark brown with a hint of red. Quickly vanishing light brown head. Nuts, roast, and some alcohol warmth. However quite watery body. Didnt enjoy it that much.

Pours reddish brown into the bottle with a decent crown that fairly rapidly dissipates. Aroma is caramel malt. Taste reminds strongly of a traditional altbier: malty, lightly sweet, hints of toffee, and with very little bitterness. However there is also a lightly smoky undertone, and dominant is a sourness that is not unfairly characterized as rotting apple. Just a touch above being light bodied. Decent.

Pours light dark, brown, with very pronounced head, which quickly diminishes. Aroma of roast coffee, yeast, and a hint of caramel. Taste is very carbonated at first, then the fizziness quickly dissipates and gives way to a light, yet complex sweet taste. No bitter finish or aftertaste. A very positive surprise. A good dunkel!
UPDATED: FEB 24, 2016 0,5 l Flasche. Braunes Bier, cremefarbener Schaum. Röstaromen, malzig süß. Für ein dunkles Bier sehr süffig.

(Andechser Export Dunkel) Bottle 500ml athome, served into a dimpled mug, ABV 4.9%
Beuatiful amber colour on the body, tall and thick beige head on top, with low retention though.
Nice malty aroma with hints of caramel and toffee.
Taste follows, nice malts, toffee, hints of chocolate.
Medium body, good carbonation.
Very good.
50cl bottle. Another great beer from the Andechs brewery. Beautiful colour, lots of thickness an a great taste.

Pours reddish brown, clear, with yellowish off-white head.
Visually medium carbonation.
Aroma: intense malt aroma, which takes on biscuit, caramel and Honey.
Flavor: malt flavors take on biscuit, with hint of honey, supported with hop flavors, which takes on stone fruits, with some floral elements.
Finish is dry, slightly sweet and bitter. Body is moderate medium, texture is smooth, carbonation is medium.

Beautiful Amber color with tan head. Aroma is dark malts, caramel, schwarzbrot, not so much rusty nails. Taste is full-bodied malts, more schwarzbrot. Pleasant mouthfeel, quite dry. Slightly metallic finish, but not bothering at all. An excellent Dunkel!

UPDATED: DEC 15, 2015 Clear mahogany color with brown head. Aroma has roasted malts and dark bread crust. Taste is on the sweet side with caramel and bready malts. Body is medium and crisp. A really nice dunkel overall.
Ruby brown, rich beige head, some lacing. Delicate aroma of bread crust, dark fruits, caramel. Same notes in taste. Watery texture, refreshing, medium dry fruity aftertaste.

Bottle at Zur Alstadt, Spandau, 20/07/15.
Rich brown with a decent beige cap.
Nose is tarte fruit, cocoa powder, biscuit, dark malt.
Taste comprises tangy dark fruits, light spice, cocoa rub, biscuit malt, raisens, straw.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close.
Decent dunkel with a light sour edge.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: (Flasche) Es hat eine braune Farbe mit einem rubinroten Einstich, ist klar filtriert mit einer bräunlichen Schaumkrone. Das Aroma ist malzig, karamellig und etwas nussig. Der Geschmack ist schlank, nussig, etwas adstringent, mit Karamalz aber etwas oxidiert.

L:
-pours a clear copper-ruby with a medium,foamy,beige head
-medium carbonation visible
S:
-bready,plums,raisins,dates,strawberr hip
T:
-plums,raisins,dates,rose hip,strawberries
F:
-medium carbonation
-light body
O:
Great Dunkel.
Reminded me of Rose hip Tea

At Great British Beer Festival 2015. Day 3. Dark brown beer with a nice and lasting beige head. Malty caramel aroma, chocolate, toffee, grassy notes. Roasted malt flavor, biscuits, grapes, chocolate, caramel, dark bread, some cocoa. Very pleasant dunkel.

Pours a dark coppery brown color, topped with a fair beige colored head. Pleasant malty aroma with notes of roastiness and caramel. Taste is sweet at start, followed by likewise roastiness and caramel, light bitterness in the finish. A nice one.
BOTTLE 50 CL. Clear chestnut brown, beige creamy head. Malty and caramel aroma, some spicy hops too. The flavour is similar, with a light to medium clean body. Clean and simple, but too boring.
500ml Bottle - Copper red in colour. Raisins, malt and caramel in the aroma. Brown sugar, nuts, raisins, toffee and some slightly roasted notes feature in the taste. A tasty dunkel.

From the bottle, pours a dark brown with orange highlights and a tan head. The smell is roasted malt, brown sugar, bread. The taste is dark bread, molasses, dark roasted malt sweetness ending with some crispness. The body is light+ with average carbonation.
Poured deep reddish brown with a frothy tan head. Aroma of sweet dark fruit, Light to medium body, flavour is liquorice, plums, sweet candy.
Malty aroma with some roasted notes. Red-Brownish color with medium head, carbonation is medium. Medium bodied with low hops, some roastflavors as well. Decent Dunkel

0,5 l bottle. Pours out in a dark red brown with a mighty foamy light beige head. Malt and coffie on the nose. Taste is more roasted malt with licorice and toffee. Hints of resin. Not scratchy, more in a smooth way. Longlasting aftertaste. Really nice one for that kind of beer.
Bottle from Beers of Europe. Pours chestnut with a light tan froth. Sweet black lager, smooth, dark fruits. Malty back. Proper dunkel.

50cl bottle bb08/2015, local Edeka. Dull sweetish malt porridge nose, vegemite, some toast and stale cinnamon. Roasted grain, cereal, soggy cornflakes in toffee. Light mouthfeel. Drinks like a chuggably thin macro Dunkel, lacking depth, precise contours or edge, - balanced being a synonym of timid & underdosed here. Lots more character to be had in neighbouring Bavarian Dunkels...
Bottle. Aroma is toffee, malty. Taste is toffee, malty, sweet, caramel, finish is light bitter. Decent

Tiefdunkel-rötliches Bier. Röstig-süßlicher Antrunk, nicht zu süß, aber auch nicht zu herb. Brauner Zucker, leicht verbrannte Töne, aber auch nicht zu tief. Schön süffig, malzig-süßlich mit leichter Herbe im Nachgeschmack!
Good dunkel. Pours a dark brown with foamy head. Didnt get much in the way of aroma. Flavor was slightly sweet. Medium body with a fairly thin texture. Fairly short finish.

Aroma: roasted caramel, roasted malts, dried red fruits.
Appearance: nice clear brown color, amazing huge beige head.
Taste: low bitterness, roasted malts, roasted caramel, red dried fruits, semisweet, slightly watery.
Palate: low body and medium carbonation, roasted finish.
Overall: Really pleasent dunkel.
Couleur ambrée sombre, légère mousse. Nez malt et caramel. Gout malté, caramel, avec notes grillées. Bon corps. Fin un peu levures et grillé. Pas trop mal
Bavarian abbey beer, dark brown with thick foam. Discrete, but good aroma, tastes of rock candy, chocolate, cream and maybe a bit of wood. Almost no aftertaste.

Pours a slightly clear ruby/brown with a medium tan head. Aroma is malty and sweet...like fresh wort...notes of wheaty spice, caramel, dark fruit and grains. Flavor follows suit but adds mild earthy hop notes that help to achieve a nice balance...tasty and crushable. Mouthfeel is full and the finish is malty/earthy and crisp...lingers to more earthiness. Pretty damn good dunkel!

Bottle from Cotteridge Wines; clear chestnut brown pour with a creamy beige head, nut and caramel aroma, taste is sweet and malty, with some bread dough, toffee, dark fruits, surprisingly refreshing with some aggressive carbonation.
Mørk rødbrun farge med et beige skum. Aroma av malt, frukt, kaffe, sjokolade og metall. Smaken følger aroma, veldig metallisk avsluttning.
Rotbräunliches, leuchtendes Bier. In der Nase Malz, Röstnoten, Karamell. Am Gaumen röstig, herzhaft, würzig. Gute Kohlensäure, etwas wässrig.

Beige good head. Dark clear ruby brown body. Aroma; chocolate malts, plums, grass, hops, leaves. Taste; plums, dark fruity malts, chocolate, hops, grass, apples, wet straw. Palate; nice, slightly mealy, slightly dry.
Finishes with sugar-bread (tart-bread), chocolate, sweet grains, dark bread. Overall nice brew.
[50 cl. br btl. 4.9%abv. °. BB14.10.14]
Redgolden yellow foam that dosnt last. Malt and dry metal in the aroma. Mlat, biscuit metallic bitter aftertaste, high in carbon
Deep amber pour, light colored head. A mix of malt, wheat and surprisingly some metallic notes. Not as good as the other 2 I tried.
(bottle) clear deep amber colour with a small brown head; aroma of stewed fruit, bit of soy sauce; clean, refreshing flavour with no finish
Schönes malziges Bier, sehr süß im antrunk und im Abgang etwas leichter Hopfen, schmeckt wie ein Altbier, was ich sehr gut finde. Schönes Bier, gefällt mir!

0.5L bottle. Pours a clear red-brown with a frothy tan head that dissipates relatively quickly. Aromas of brown sugar, roasted malt, chocolate and prune. Initial light malt sweetness quickly gives way to somewhat citrusy middle followed by a long roasted malt nobel hop linger. Surprisingly medium-light mouthfeel with minimal carbonation. Overall, a quafable dunkel, not the best out there, and not the best beer from kloster andechs

Bottle. A malty smell, light sweet, some bread. The small beige head is creamy-foamy with a rather short duration. The body is red to pale brown. A malty taste with a hidden sweetness of cola, a nice bitter touch in the finish (which is mild and long). The body is light to medium strong, creamy with a normal carbonation. A very good beer.

Good dunkel beer.
brown and clear with a medium head. roasty/malty aroma. pleasing carbonization. light body, refreshing.
Bottle. Pours clear brown with quickly disappearing yellow head. Aroma is cocoa, caramel, hint of smoke and charcoal. Flavor is cocoa, malt, charcoal, slightly bitter.

500ml bottle as Export Dunkel. Many thanks to djoeye. Good looking with a tight, fawn-coloured head with fine retention and fair lacing. Deep dark ruby coloured body. Smell of bread, slightly roasted. Clean taste of nuts, chocolate, caramel and marmalade. Mid-dry malty ending. Drinks well (Tromsø 16.05.2014).

Serving: from bottle--purchased at Allendörfer.

Aroma: lightly sweet, malty aroma.

Appearance: average sized, frothy, off-white initial head with no lacing and mostly diminishing longevity. Clear, dark-amber body.

Taste: moderately sweet, molasses initial flavor and finish with average duration.

Palate: medium body, oily texture and lively carbonation.

Overall: too sweet.

Bottle from Galeria Kaufhof. It pours clear mahogany brown with a small beige head. The nose is roasty, toast, chocolate, pepper and brown bread. The taste is toasty, cocoa, earth, brown bread, nut, touch of pepper and light bitterness with a dry finish. Medium body and moderate carbonation. Really rather well balanced. On the top echelon of dunkels.

Bottle bought a few months back, drunk at home. Thin ruddy brown with a small beige head. Looks a bit weedy. Nice aroma of chocolate malt and caramel. Taste is sweet, not very complex, a bit boring actually. Medium sweet finish with a slight sour-bitter tang. Nice but not a lot of personality, the alcohol is well-hidden.
medium light brown head. Clear caramel brown colour. Roasty malt aroma with caramel notes. Spicy and slightly roasty taste. Bitter-sourish palate with a roasty note.
500 ml bottle. Pours clear dark brown with a medium brownish head. Roasty malt aroma. Light-bodied, tad on the sour side. Roasty palate.
Ins Glas ergießt sich ein dunkelbraunes Bier mit schöner Schaumkrone. Geruch röstmalzig, Karamell, leicht würzig. Geschmack angenehm röstmalzig, leichte schokoladige Noten, leicht würzig.
50cl bottle. Pours dar brown with a moderate, mostly diminishing beige head. Aroma is mainly caramel, also sweet malty. Flavor is also dominated by caramel, light roasted malt. Texture is oily.

Bottle at home from GBBF. Clear burnt orange / red colour with a thin persistent greyish cream head. Aroma is sweet brown caramel with some soap, low yeast esters. Flavour is dull pils backbone with a touch od roast and some caramel. Slight chalk in the water profile. Medium sweet finish. Palate is light and a bit thin. Lively carbonation. Pretty filling.
9/9/12. Slightly roasty. much less body than the doppelbock, but almost as rich. Like a bock with roast. a deep dark red color. many beers deep this day.
Bottle at Gbbf 2013. Dark brown lasting beige head. Its ok some malt its a little dull. Ok
Deep cherrywood brown; moderate yellowish head; toasty aroma; tastes of sweetish toasted malt, brown bread; smooth, dry, a bit dusty; pleasant drinking.
On tap in Wiebaden. Not a bad dunkel. Dark reddish brown colour. Sweet, malty, a bit of fruit. Tasty.

On tap at the monastery. Pours a deep brown colored body with a two inch, frothy and creamy, tan head that dissipates slowly and leaves a nice lacing. Aroma is medium sweet, bready caramels with a light toast and roast, some dark fruits, and touches of chocolate. Flavor is similar. Bready, medium sweet caramels with a light chocolate, some toast and roast, dark fruits, and light toffee notes. Finishes clean and mostly dry with a very light bitterness. Lengthy aftertaste following a smooth, medium body and a soft, moderately lively carbonation. Overall, a very nice dunkel. Sweet, but balanced and very easy drinking. Great beer.

Very little aroma.  Pretty dark amber color, fine bubbles, no head.  Taste is rather alcoholic and sharpish.  I have a bit of a sore throat, and think its interfering with my ability to appreciate this.  I thought I would like it more than I do.
Keg at Andechs Am Dom. Brown with an off white head. Sweet caramel and a light ventilated note. Delicious with a plate of pork.
Tap at the Andechs in Munich. A high grade Dunkel that delivers a complex array of flavours.

Draft @ Kleines Andechs in Mainz. Clear deep amber with a big foamy light beige head. Aroma is lots of bready malt, caramel, cereal grain and light smoke. Flavor is rich doughy bread with lightly sweet caramel malt and a balancing bitterness. Medium body with a smooth mouth feel. Very good dunkel, super rich and malt while still being very drinkable.
Pours clear, dark amber. Head dissipates quickly. Strong molasses aroma. Very lively. Finish is slightly sticky. Only a bit sweet. Pretty good.

Head: beige. Colour: clear, copper. Aroma: hops, malt. Taste: some pleasant bitter, chocolate. Palate: medium bitter finish. Overall: very nice,

Dark brown. Small tan head. Little lacing. Roasted malt aroma. Smooth malt flavor with some chocolate.  Sweet with a little mineral bite. Not too shabby. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

50cl bottle pours with a clear amber body that has some ruby red hues and supports a tan head of foam. The aroma has a nice bit of sweet caramel and brown sugar on it and then heading into a bit of earthy malts, a slight dark roasted maltiness and faint prune like dark fruity esters. The taste has a nice mix of light dark roasted malts and caramel malts to go along with snippets of thin vague hoppiness, a dash of sweet dark fruity esters and then a mineral to earthy note joins in on toward the finish. Another tasty one from this brewery.

Brown with a tanned head liquid. Malt aroma with some toffee.
In mouth some cara malts, toffee and caramel. The end is sweet.
This and the doppelbock are the best of Andechs.
Botte shared with McTapps. Nice one with some malt in the aroma and taste. Quite refreshing for that style with a great malty finish without becoming dull. Top one.

Bottle. Deep brown-black colour, with steady head and smooth body. Nose of spicy malt. Taste of malt, nuts, roasted grains, basement, caramel and torf. Really nice one and also quite quaffable, but there are better beers of this brewery.

UPDATED: FEB 17, 2013 Bottle. Pours a dark auburn brown with a brownish head that disappears quickly. Aroma is dark bread, dark fruitiness, nuts, some toast. The taste is fairly dry with loads dark, malt bread and nuts. Some caramel and light fruitiness, raisin. Delicious. Palate is fairly light, fairly light on the carbonation as well. Superb, really.

Bottled, 0.50l. Clear dark brown color with medium creamy brownish head and soft visible carbonation. Aroma of grassy hops, light roasted hops and some vanilla. Taste starts with spicy malt, followed with mild roast and refreshing yeasty sourness, while finished moderately bitter. Medium to full body, thick texture and soft carbonation in palate. Dunkels are good, this one is even better...

(Tap) Bevuta al Deutsche Bierfest. Aroma lieve, troppo... Si percepisce comunque un vago sentore maltato e di caramello. Al palato stesse impressioni: malto, caramello ma sempre molto lievi (è una dunkel per carità ma mi aspettavo qualcosa di più). Corpo acquoso, incredibilmente beverina. Forse bevuta un pò fredda e senza attenzione.

#115
Dunkelbraun mit ordentlich Schaum obendrauf. Eine blockmalzartige Würzmalznote im Aroma. Der Antrunk ist samtig und erstaunlich flüssig. Geschmacklich sehr malzig, Toffee-Noten, etwas Blockmalz, nicht klebrig. Im Nachgang herber werdend. Wunderbar süffig geraten. Ein Andechser, dass an den großen Bruder (Doppelbock) erinnert, aber insgesamt wesentlich bekömmlicher ist! Tolles Dunkel aus Andechs, dem Wallfahrtsort für Biertrinker!
	
Test vom 11.1.2010, Gebinde: Glasflasche 	Noten: 12,12,14,12,12,12 - 12,30

50 cl bottle @ home, BBE 17.04.2013
Aroma has toasted notes, some chocolate, nuts and hints of metal. Flavour has chocolate, some nuts and distant metallic notes. Finishes with bready malt. The metal notes disturb a bit here, but this is still one good dunkel.

28/X/12 - 50cl bottle as "Export Dunkel" from the little supermarket in Andechs @ home - BB: 3/IV/13 (2012-1205) 
Clear purple red brown beer, aery beige head, unstable, non adhesive. Aroma: caramel, grains, hay, stable, some mocha, bit earthy. MF: ok carbon, medium to light body. Taste: some caramel, bready, toast, bit nutty, mocha, cocoa powder. Aftertaste: cow fodder, caramel, grains, wholebread, bitter ending.
Bottle. Dusty chestnut with a tan head. Aroma is brown sugar syrup. Flavour is chocolate powder, roast malt. Finish is dry sweet.

Pours a very dark red but not black, with medium head that dissipates quite fast. Smells quite sour and of smelly feet. Taste is better, sweeter, with hints of caramel. Not too carbonated and a very short and empty aftertaste. Some malts. Not one of my favorites.
Bottled,Dark brown with a puffy off-white head.Aroma of Burnt rubber,Christmas cookies and spice with flavors of pool water,lemon water,cappuccino foam,biscuits and caramel..
Bottle: #99 on my RateBeer travel list to Germany. Sweet, brown sugar / syrop, malt taste. Aroma is weak. Pours solid oak brown with an off white lasting head. A bit thin. Food Pairing: Bockwurst.

Bottle. Brown, dark, clear with small head. Warm soft nutty-roasted, light coffee nose. A bit of sweetness, some cola, butterscotch. A bit of wood. Palate is soft and nice. Medium-plus bodied, feels soft, almost creamy. Well bittered. Dry/bit tannic finish. A nice soft dunkel with some nuttyness. Feels fresh.-- bb/h

AROMA: coffee, cola,roasty, 
APPEARANCE: brown, black, clear, minimal head, 
TASTE: light sweetness, roast grain flavor, hints of coffee
PALATE:light body, slick feel, soft carbonation, bitter, 
OVERALL: Nice dunkel from Andechser, smooth and mild, pleasant taste with slightly aftertaste

Bottle. Clear red/brown color with light brown creamy head. Nice mild aroma of nuts, almonds, caramel, grapes, maple syrup. Flavor is light bitter at the start with a lot of nuts. It gets a bit more bitterness and intensity in the aftertaste and leave nice almond taste in the mouth. Texture is on a half way between watery and oily.
Tap @ Andechs. Dark amber appearance with a creamy light brown head. Toasty, nutty, light grassy aroma. Slightly burnt, a touch smoky, dark toasty, toasty malty flavor. Nice stuff.

UPDATED: JUL 27, 2012 500ml bottle. Aroma is sweet and dark fruits, malty-ish. Appearance is very dark amber with a white head. Taste is malty, coffe-ish bitterness and sweetness. A little watery but a nice malty finish. A little too less carbonation but still very nice overall. A good dunkel.
Sweet aroma of caramel and dark maltiness. Taste of malts, lots of caramel and also caramel in the aftertaste.

500 ml bottle.
Pours a dark brown colour with a minimal white head. Aroma of toasted malts, nuts. ash and even some barnyard. Flavour of toasted malts, nuts, dark bread, tobacco and grassy hops. Medium bodied, harsh and thin mouthfeel and rough carbonation. Finishes dry and malty with bready notes. Good.
Bottle. Pours coca cola colored with a off white head. Notes of butter, nougat, syrup and chocolate. Quite thin actually, altough refreshing.
21/1/12 - Winter Beer Festival at Manchester. Good malty dunkel with a refreshing bite afterwards.

Darker brown, creamy beige head. Does have some banana but also mild spices, dough and roasted nuts. Medium carbonation, light sweet and roasted flavour. hint of sourness. Not very complex in the end. (50cl bottle)
500ml bottle from Bierzwerg. Deep amber colour with medium head. Aroma is malt, caramel. Flavour is malt, sweet.

500 ml bottle hand-carried just a day ago from Germany by C,N & E (Thanks!!). Part of a multi-pack souvenir selection. They got to go to the Andechs Monastery, but this was the next best thing for those of us that didnt go to Germany. The bottle had a May 2012 freshness date. Gorgeous brown in the glass with a nice tan foamy head. Light carbonation. A hint of sweet biscuity malt with a hint of caramel in the nose. Initial taste was incredibly smooth, balanced, a touch sweet (but definitely in balance), with a very subtle roast malt flavor--the classic "Dunkel" taste. What I didnt taste were any of the off flavors that sometimes accompany older, imported Germans (not referring to myself there). I see why they raved about the drinkability of the local beers on tap in country. They are incredibly fresh tasting and go down oh so easily. Looking forward to the other bottles in the selection. Thanks again C,N & E (and K too).

Brown half-litre bottle, best before 20 Oct 2010, drank during my German tasting evening 2 July 2010. Poured into my tall Wolnzacher Brauhaus (Hopfenperle) glass.

Very suprised to find Ive never reviewed this beer before!

The beer has a redwood tree, brown hue to it, the head is a healthy cream coloured crown.

Malty aromas rise from the glass and a sweet malty brew hits your lips as you dive into the beer, to be completely engulfed by its charms.

This is a very drinkable beer, a little on the sweet side for some, but I really like it and have one whenever our paths cross.

caramel, chocolate, nuts, resin, leaves, banana, woody, brown, clear, tan foam, minimal head, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, medium sourness, full body, slick feel, average carbonation, long finish,
Clear dark amber with an off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel and nutty. Flavor is quite sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish. 130312
Bottle. Clear amber with medium tan head. Aroma is malt, caramel, fruit,  . Flavour is malt, caramel, fruit, hops, nutty, medium sweet, little bitter and a tiny bit toffee.

Bottle.  Pours clear dark amber with a medium, fizzy off-white head, medium retention with light lacing.  Aroma is caramel, nutty and toast malt, leaves and earthy hops and dates.  Flavor is malty with dark fruity esters, light hops and bitterness and a sweet finish.  Medium body and carbonation, low warmth.

nuts, grass, chocolate, rotten eggs, cough drop, butterscotch, licorice, smoke, black, cloudy, tan foam, rocky head, medium sweetness, very bitter, medium sourness, umami, full body, creamy, oily feel, average carbonation, bitter, long finish,
Bottle. Pours clear deep amber with a medium light tan head. The aroma is caramel and toasted malt. Some dark fruity notes. The flavour is light smoke, caramel, toasted malt and sweet tobacco.

Bottle at the Schwarzes Cafe in Berlin.  Clear, copper body with a 1", off-white, frothy head.  Toast and bread crust in the nose with light raisin.  Flavors of brown sugar with more light raisin.  Low level toffee.  Medium bodied with fairly high carbonation.  Malt forward with low bitterness.  Crisp finish with light malt notes hanging around.  Overall very tasty and repeatable, but could use a little more depth.
Ambe/brown color small beige head. Sweet malty aroma with caramel and ripe fruit notes. Roasted,, sweet malt taste with lots of caramel, A great dunkel.
UPDATED: DEC 22, 2011 Bottle from Kris Wines. Quite a light reddish dunkel, sweetish malt, bread, not too much bitterness. Good dunkel, nothing extraordinary.
Bottle.Dark amber colour with medium white head.Aroma of malt and caramel,hoppy with slight tosted taste of bread and dark berrys,smooth mouthfeels and medium body.
Thanks to Todd for sharing.  Brown pour with a thin beige head.  Aroma is quite complex showIng hints of toffee, nuts, dark fruit and sweet malts.  Flavor follows suite.  Very nice dunkle

brown and clear with a medium head which is very stable. when you finish the beer, theres still a little frothy head left. very nice appearance. very roasty/malty aroma. hints of chocolate and very few hops. pleasing carbonization. light body. could need some more "depth"

Draft @ Berlin beer festival 2011.
note de levure de cave, herbacé avec qcq épices, malt fin caramel.
En bouche une bière grillée touche de levure, impression de toffee-cara avec note liquoreuse, la fin est bien maltée, note de café.
Bonne bière, surtout sur le profile du malt qui lui donne une belle dimension grillé et de caramel.

On tap at Kloster Andechs - Das Wirtshaus in Nurnberg. Dark brown with reddish undertones and a decent, off-white head. Sweet, caramel and berry fruit aroma with some grassy hops. Flavour of toffee and roasted malts, with some more fruit and dryish finish. Good.
I dk if i had this or the "fest dunkel" but it is a solid dunkel, malty but fruity, with some hops, smooth nad drinkable.
Bottle from Super Brugsen Højby. Dark brown colour with an off-white head. Aroma and flavour of roasted malt, chococlate, caramel and with fruity notes.
Bottle @ Home. Pours clear ebony with a offwhite head. Aroma of malt, bread, nuts. Taste is roasted malt, caramel, nuts. Thin to medium body, soft carbonation, dry finish. 070711

Beim dunklen Andechs steht das Malzaroma nicht im Vordergrund, dafür aber ein doch überraschend rauchiges Aroma, das mir persönlich zusagt, im Gegensatz zu manchem Rauchbier. Mir persönlich kommt es so vor, alswürde das rauchige Aroma nach einigen Schlücken an Kraft verlieren, dann steht wirklich das Malz im Vordergrund. Im Nachgeschmack versucht sich das würzig malzige Aroma zu etablieren, leider geht das etwas zu schnell unter. Den Nachgescmack hätte ich mir länger gewünscht. Ansonsten schneidet das Bier auch wegen seiner Süffigkeit recht gut ab. 	 
Test vom 19.9.2006, Gebinde: Glasflasche 	Noten: 8,11,13,11,12,12 - 11,45
Bottle 50cl, a clear amber brown beer with good head. Nose is on brown bread. Aroma is toasted and chocolate like, good bread body, not much hops, a good beer but not exceptional.

Bottle from Bierzwerg, Cologne. Pours mahogany with a steady 2" light brown head. Aroma is light nutty malts, fine roasted. Taste is rich malty, moderate sweet, with a suitable amount of grassy hops. Sticky mouthfeel. Lingering dark caramel aftertaste.

on tap @ Andechser Hof, Tutzing am Starnberger See. Clear brown colour with a huge, creamy beige head. Arom aof caramel. Shy malty base, not sweet at all, flavours of roasted malts and shy hints of caramel and bitter chocolate, perhaps cocoa powder. Rather dry, not sweet at all. Smooth palate. A very nice one.

At Kloster Andechser vom Fass. Poured mahogny in color with foamy tan head. Faint roasted malts and metallic notes in aroma. Slightly sweet malty with some sticky notes as well. Pleasant light sweet aftertaste.
Bottle from Bierzwerg. Mahogany color with small white head. Aroma, light in chocolate, caramel, roasted bread. Taste, light coffee, caramel, fruity finish. I am little bit disappointed.

500 ml bottle slightly over its freshness date (27. January 2011), into tulip. Deep coppery, clear body is topped by rather low yet well-sustained creamy, light tan head that sticks to the walls and leaves only a bubbly patch of lace as it slowly dies out. Nose lacking any overt hop aroma is rich Munich malt sweetness with melanoidins reminiscent of a bread crust, hint of chocolate and nutty notes. Medium bodied with moderate carbonation and creamy mouthfeel. The beer is moderately sweet from unfermentable sugars but not cloying or sticky, with bread crust flavor (from the melanoidin-containing Munich malt) and mild roastiness in the background. The balance is leaned towards the malty side and hoppy bitterness remains hidden until the semi-dry finish when it shows up.
50 cl bottle, Sheffield, UK via The Dram Shop. Mahogany amber, sweet warming brown sugar aroma. Velvety, chocolate and caramel with a nutty finish.

50cl bottle  (export dunkel) from Bierzwerg. Poured deep mahogany color with a white head. Aroma is caramel and roasted malt, flavor similar, roasted malt leading to a quite dry finish. Really nice dunkel, very drinkable.
27th June 2007  Warning! Early amateur rating! Sumptuos chocolatey dark beer. Malty sweetnes dry finish.

500 ml bottle. As Andechser Export Dunkel. From bierzwerg.de.
Dark ruby red colour with small off-white head.
Mild caramel and roasted malty aroma. Flavour is malt and some grassy hops. Highly drinkable and rich Dunkel.

500 mL bottle from Beers of Europe poured into a pint glass.  Lovely cooked aroma.  A light brown with a good head.  This is an excellent example of a roasted dark beer, say no more.  by a long way one of the best German beers Ive tried.

Pours an elegant deep coppery body, crowned by a medium, off-white head with a certain staying power. Aroma is faint roasted malts, with hints of bread and caramel. Taste is even more roasted; you can virtually feel the crackling of heated grains against your tongue as you drink. Aftertaste is milder, with hints of freshly baked bread, nuts, caramel and burnt sugar. Full-bodied, and with a smooth palate. A very sturdy, almost stout-like dunkel from Andechser, and definitely among the more roasty specimens of the genre - sometimes its just so good to get away from all that caramel...

Great conditioning - the head doesnt pillow initially, but it does linger. Wonderful dark brown, but on the lighter end. The aroma is plenty of wood and forest, dark wheat bread - incredible. The flavor is grainy, bready, slightly sweet, and a little hoppy. Delicious and insanely drinkable. I cannot believe how lucky I am to have a source for Andechs in my town (Thank you Alma Delikatesy!). Best before Dec 2010.
user_location: Łódż, Warsaw, Poland; Michigan, Ohio, USA

text: Bottled. Nutbrown color with a gorgeous creamy off-white head with nicely layered lacing. Nose is malty, and a bit of roasted tones already. Aroma is malty, roasted and some caramel. Flavor is quite sweet and less then desired bitter. Medium body, soft slicky swallow and tender carbonation. Excellent dunkel. Please make it just a bit of less sweet  to make it perfect.

500ml bottle from KaDeWe. Labeled Export Dunkel.
Appearance : Clear amber with a small head that goes away fast. Not much lacing.

Aroma : Mineral with light notes of raisins and red fruits. Vague notes of caramel. Quite light. 

Taste : Mineral with slight notes of caramel and raisins. Some red fruits also. Some notes of toffee. Carbonation very fizzy. 

Overall : Nothing bad but it feels really mainstream. Nothing special. The mineral taste gets a bit unpleasant by the end of the bottle.

Bottle. Dark copper with an uneven, persisting yellow-tan head draping the glass.. Deep, pungently malty, slightly brackish aroma conjuring gravy, soy, walnut, leather, Nutella on rye bread, wax and some herbal, bay leaf-like hop as it hits room temp. Clean, bready and substantial with layers of soy and chocolate nuttiness; bitter, faintly roasted finish softening into an insistent hazelnut and Nutella on wholemeal toast aftertaste. Quality.

(bottle) pours a clear copper-ruby colour with a frothy off-white head. aroma of slightly toasted grainy pale malts, herbal hops and pretzels. flavour is mostly roasted malts, with notes of coffee, butter and nuts, nicely balanced and smooth. medium body and carbonation.

0,5 l bottle, bought at Sörspecialista.hu
Poured clear brown with a small froathy tan head. Roasted grains, espresso-like coffee, toasted aroma with some toffee, sourish yeast. Medium bodied one with caramel at first, after that bits the taste of roasted grains, some fruity raisins, light dark chocolate. Bitter, dry, roasted aftertaste

(Bottle, Monks Café Wallingatan, Stockholm) Reddish brown colour with frothy, beige head. Malty, slightly roasted nose with dark bread, wort and hints of spices. Malty, toasty taste with notes of dark bread, wort, a touch of orange and a balanced, spicy bitterness in the finish. Medium body, clean malt profile with some sweetness. Well balanced and tasty dunkel, not straying too far from the safe.

Bottle from Beers of Europe. Clear reddish-brown pour with a white head. Aromas of chocolate, roasted malts, raisins, toffee, dark fruits. Flavours of coffee, some smoke, sweet spices, butterscotch, vanilla, blackcurrant. Sweet, malty mouthfeel. Sweet, malty finish with some light bitterness. Not bad.

Bottled (BZ, 09/2010)
Deep ruby color, good creamy beige head. Light nose is a bit toasted malty with grassy hoppyness. Flavor is mostly caramel, some toasted cocoa-like flavors and light grassy hoppyness. Quite thin palate. Just an average dunkel.

Bottle.

A - Deep redish brown with an average sized off-white foamy head. Decent retention and a little bit of lacing.

S - Lots of bread and caramel malt. A little nutty roasted smell. Pretty faint smell.

T - A lot like the smell. Good amount of sweet caramel, bread malts. Toasted malt and some mild sugar. Some dark fruit (mostly cherry). A bit of grassy and floral hops provide a bit of balance to the sweetness.

M - Medium body and a good amount of carbonation. Pretty creamy and smooth.

D - Easy to drink and goes down smooth. Really nice, malt forward beer with enough balance that it doesnt get too sweet.

Notes: Good darker malt beer. Good filing bread like taste and smooth mouthfeel make drinking this quite pleasurable.

0.5 l bottle.
Mahogany colour, creamy (thinly on top remaining) pale brown head and average carbonation.
Roasty, hoppy smell, the start is sharp, tastes sweet, flavours caramell-liked.
Aroma of roasted malt, grassy/citrus hops and yeast, the finish is hoppy, citric and dry.
A nice and good balanced, medium bodied brew with a moderate sticky and slick texture.

0.5L bottle, courtesy of Schutzenliesel. Thanks, Tom! Pours a dense, deep copper color; fluffy, very light-tan head excellent retention and texture; lacing that coats the glass; formidable head here; great pour. Gorgeous presence of smoked meats, caramel, and tobacco in the nose; some brown sugar, but nothing overly sweet; a very nice, spicy smoke character thats lovely here; crisp, refreshing nose. Medium mouthfeel: solid amounts of caramel, light brown sugar notes, and that persistent smoked meat note appearing in the background; a touch of a metallic presence, but that quickly dissipates; a refreshing, lively, fully attenuated dunkel: this puts so many American renditions to shame; excellent, just not as dense or as savory as their doppelbock. The smoked meat note shows prominently again in the finish, alongside light caramel and hints of brown sugar; again, no residual stickiness or anything close to it; crisp and lively and perfectly balanced at the end.

Half-liter bottle pours dark brown with red highlights, decent tan head. Chocoaltey, toffeeish, slightly fruity nose. Perfectly balanced and well-rounded flavor... malty sweetness and firm, crisp bitterness. Meaty yet refreshing, flavorful yet quaffable. Great all-around beer.

Draft.  Drak brown to amber color.  Roasted almost smoky malt aroma.  Lightly fruity and hints of caramel.  Very drinkable, but very satisfying.  Very little bitterness and concentration of malt falvor with little aftertaste.

From a bottle that I picked up in Dinklesbuhl; I think I opened this up in Salzburg.  I think I liked this one more than their more esteemed brew.  Color was a dark amber/auburn with a foamy head.  Aroma of roasted malt, smoke, caramel and sweet malt.  Flavor was much of the same; pretty smoky and nutty.
Golden-brown colour.  Very toasty aroma with light chocolate accents.  Earthy, toasty character with some bitter chocolate and a late nuttiness.  Decent example of the style - simple and clean.

500. Thanks, BVC! Clear medium brown with a little loose gray on top. Mild earthy smoky nose. Beautiful light body. Easy drinking, smoky, woody, earthy, leafy mid-palate. Awesomely sessionable little dark lager with no flaws, but has shockingly little flavor compared to the Hard Ball Dark we drank right before it. Especially given that its abv is 10% higher.

Draft @ Nurnberg Andechs. Is a gorgeous dark brown glowing coppery red in the light with an aery head. Aroma is bready, with bread crust. Juicy quaffable palate is just right. the flavors are simple brown bread and some caramel malts. I really dont want anything more than a very drinkable liquid bread experience. The beer delivers.

Bottle in Osaka. Medium brown with a red-orange tint. Nice, pitted, tan head. Dry caramel and roasted malt aroma. Very light body. Think taste. Sweetish, with a decent lingering caramel flavor that dries out in the end. OK balance, but rather flavorless. Does not cross the oceans well. Was much nicer on tap at the monastery.
bottle - dark brown beer with beige head. Aroma has some metal and caramel. Flavour is malty and not to sweet. Hints of metal.

Had this on tap at the Kloster Andechs outside Munich, which probably added to my experience.  The beer has a very deep red/brownappearance with a perfectly smooth creamy head.  The aroma hints of caramel and almost a cherry (but not fruity) hint.  Nice light spicy flavor with a ver full flavor finish.  It was great beer with or without food.
Nice malty beer, really nice with good taste of caramel. Easy to drink, nice refreshment
Enjoyed in Munich. Light brown body with large rocky head. Malty nose. Taste of malts, caramel, nuts. Quite light and easy to drink. Nice one.

50cl Bottle from De Bierkoning. Clear chestnut brown colour, lasting off-white head. Aroma of nuts, light roasted malts, some caramel. Flavour is light sweet, nutty, caramel, rye. Very light dry roasted finish. All light flavours actually.
UPDATED: APR 7, 2010 500 ml bottle its better on tap. Basically a lighter version of the Doppebock. A good soild dark beer great with food. Like all the Andechs beers a great effort.

Dark rusty red/brown pour with a smooth beige head. Dark fruit and caramel in the nose. Soft spiciness in the finish builds against the layers of malt up front. Overall this rounds out really nicely, very flavorful dunkel with a beautiful ease of drinkability.

Shared this one w/ SkyCop32.  Picked up at Toom Getränke in Kaiserslautern.   Pours a deep dark brown.  Aromas of roasted malts, smoke, and hints of fruit.  Flavors of the roasted malts, some fruit, with a coffee aftertaste.

Bottle at EBF 2008.
Clear amber coloured with a small off white head.
Sweet aroma of malts and caramel with notes of hay.
Sweet flavour of malts and caramel with notes of hay, grain and hops.
Hoppy finish.

[EBF @ Copenhagen, September 2008] Small off-white light creamy head that mostly diminished. Spare display of lacework. Mahogany like color. Aroma of toasted malt, caramel, mild rye bread, grain. Medium bodied with a soft carbonation. Moderated sweet flavor. Mild toasted malty sweet finish.
Clear deep amber with medium off white head. Sweet aroma with toasted malt, caramel and floral hops. Sweet flavour with toasted malt and cardboard notes. Ends sweet.

50 cL bottle. Pours clear and golden deep cobber and brown with a light tan head. Mild spiced and breadish aroma. Light sweet initial encounter and light metallic. Mild spiced, roasted malty and sligt acidic flavour. Holds a nice balance to the roasted malt towards the finish.

From bottle. Oak brown clear body with a big beige head leaving a good lacing. Roasted malts nose with sherry-like tones and a slight smokiness. Caramelly in mouth, with some wallnuts and prunes kicking in the middle. Slightly hoppy finish but with nearly no bitter aftertaste. Heavy and round texture with medium carbonation gives all its power to this brew. A dunkel which is indeed the small and lighter brother of the Andechser Doppelbock without giving up much of its substance and success.

UPDATED: JUN 16, 2011 500ml bottle shop Volksdorf near Hamburg. (Scored a Luitpold hefe glass yeah!) Toffee and slightly biting malt profile, good mostly clean malt aroma with just a whiff of funk. Pretty hefty Dunkel, almost a Bock. Pretty great. === LATER NOTES ===  a lighter bodied and hoppier variation of the Doppelbock, plus a real lager edge, and still has some wet hay barnyard effect. Lots going on and exceptional.

(6/21/08) Draught at the Leipziger Bierbörse festival in Leipzig. Clear dark amber with a small beige head. Aroma of toasted malt and some caramel. Sweet flavor of toasted malt and caramel. Finishes on a bitter note. Medium-bodied.

Draft at Andechser am Dom. Clear, deep, dark amber - like root beer - with a big beige head. Deeply malty nose, some fruitiness. Roasty malt flavors, a whiff of smoke, almost a meaty quality - sweet, smoky meat. Amazing lace rings. Everyone should try this on draft! Excellent!

Botella. Clear bit thin dark brown colour with a short lasting fizzy light brown head. Sweet caramellic toasty malty aroma with a little smoke. Rather thin mouthfeel. The flavour has a good toasty maltiness with bitter hops, caramel along with a little smoke and chocolate. Good but too thin.

Bottle, bought @ CITTI, Flensburg.
Pours a clear, redish brown with a medium, frothy, off-white head. Aroma is sweet, some brewing cereal, maize, caramel and slight chocolate. Light mouthfeel, medium carbonation. Flavour starts of with a bit of metal, but gains in complexity. Not too much sweetness, balanced well by chocolate, light roastiness and a coffee accent at the end. Light bitter finish. Good, but the metal is just a tad too much.

No 418
Rated: 30.05.2008
Bottle brown, 500 ml
Appearance: Pours reddish - brown, carbonation is mild to medium initially, body is perfectly clear, head is off - white, frothy, cappuccino like, initially medium, slowly decreasing to small, leaving good lacing. Very impressive and good looking beer.
Aroma: Aroma is strickingly similar to the previously tasted ’Andechser Dunkles Weissbier’ but deprived of wheat and banana accents. Instead of it the beer contains more roasted barley grains, easy noticable Munich malt, cappuccino accents, slight caramelly, the Dunkel - like aroma is nice, intensive and strickingly similar to previously tasted Bohemian Dunkels, gentle hoppy nose defining and rounding tha taste of flowery kind.
Flavour: Nice, focused, roasty, bitter and dry, slightly creamy, cappuccino, roasted barley grains, no hints of additional sugar like in one popular Polish Dunkel, some bitter touch of hops with herbal to flowery gentle hoppy aroma. Finish duration is long, even some smoky touch.
Palate: Body is medium, texture is rather dry, carbonation on palate is medium, finish feel is chalky.

(Bottle) Pours dark reddish brown with a creamy sand colored head. The aroma is medium malty and light to medium hoppy with tones of juicy dark bread, grain, light caramel, light nuts, mild roast/mild coffee and herbs. The nose is very malty for 4.9 % beer. The flavour is medium malty and light hoppy with tones of roasted malt, dark bread, nuts, light caramel and herbal hops. The mouthfeel is soft and clean with a light dry and light numbing finish. Almost a tiny bit smoky in both the aroma and flavour. Medium bodied. Great brewery, I have to re: rate everything from this brewery.

BOttle 50 cl. Pours a reddish brown with a white head and a bread- almost whiskey-like aroma. The taste is full-bodied malty sweet with a coffe and hop finish. Didn’t really like it, I expected something better

good medium bodied beer that pours a thick head.Some fruitness and nuts are detected.The finish was clean but it did leave me thirsty like i had too much salt.I dont know maybe its me.Overall it was real good
Bottle 50cl. Pours mahagony clear brown Dunkel, off-white head. Roasted Malts, hoppy but not dominating, easy to drink. A slight sweet taste of chocolate an coffe in the finish. Nice beer.
The bottle looks good, the beer in the glass also. Aroma dry and dusty. Flavor is malty and a little bit fruity, not too dry. Good beer!

Cask gravity at the Andechs bräustüberl. A cloudy brown colour with a small head. A nice malty coffee aroma. Taste has plenty of malt, more coffee and a noticeable amount of alcohol. A very enjoyable dunkel.

Dark, red amber with a nice head. The aroma is slightly sweet with notes of roasted malt, caramel and hints of fruit. The flavour has a light sweetness and nice notes of roasted malt, caramel, bisquit and hints of both nuts and dark fruit. Its a smooth and pleasant dunkel with a lot of power in the flavour.
Bottle from the border. A very good dunkel, but still needs the last to beat weltenburger. Not that bad!

Amber. Aroma isnt too strong, but quite pleasant, malt and nuts, maybe. Feels a little bubbly. Flavor is a little more that of roasted malt than the aroma. Finishes smooth, easy to drink and asks for more.

Draft version. A clear deep dark dunkel with a thick creamy white head. A pleasant caramel aroma, with fruity notes, dried fruits, and alcohol. In mouth, a nutty caramel malt with light burned notes, a bit smokey. Medium bodied, lightly oily mouthfeel. On tap at Dr. Flotte, Oct. 17 2007, 2.20 euros for 330 mL.

Dark foxy-amber beer with a yellowish, initially thick-set head, slowly collapsing; Very bready nose, a bit nutty, and I seem to get a touch of alcohol aroma. Bread & breadcrust dominate, though. In the taste, we get a true  "Fastenfrühstück"  with coffee, and lean, dry brown bread. In the finish we discover that a little lump of sugar had been added, and even a dash of skimmed milk. There were also some hazelnuts from last autumn. Rahter thinnish, but seems to fill in gradually. Its not unattractive. Really one for the Lent.

best to try in the monastery on the holy hill. dark brown colour. big but not very solid head. spicy smell, roasted malts and coffee. starts malty, then with roasted aromes. mid brings hops. end is sweeter and a bit sticky on the lips. nice but miles away from the legendary doppelbock

Clear amber with some bubbles and an off-white thin head. Biscuit malts in the smell. Bitter but with some sweetness and a light dry end. In the mouth, there is some citrus hop, giving way to earthyness and some malts. Odd slightly chemical bitter end. Over carbonated, I thought.
Dark amber with a small tan foam. Malty and hoppy notes. Roasted taste with some caramel. Medium body with a slightly bitter aftertaste.
Beautiful red brown body, off white creamy head; Elegant malty bitter fresh nose; Balanced bitter body, huge carbonation, elegant; Long fresh malty bitter finish. Great well made and very drinkable.

From a 500mL Bottle.  Transparent mahogany colored pour with some ruddy overtones and a thin layer of creamy tan foam.  Some clean, straight forward aromas of raisins and a soft prune fruitiness mingle with some mild cocoa powders.  Simple, but elegant.  Light bodied, crisply carbonated mouthfeel.  Some nice dry, borderline woody characters accompanies some toasted brazil nut husks and more light chocolate on the palate.  Clean, satisfyingly refreshing finish.

Pours a clear light chestnut color with a khaki head.  Clean aroma, a very faint hint of dark spices.  Thick, accomodating palate.  Nice rich wheat character that was robust but not too heavy.  Crisp dry finish.

Tall, cavernous, thick light beige head. Clear teak body, more browns than reds. The head, which looks like sea foam with sand in it, fades slowly and leaves thick lacing behind. The aroma is a pleasant combination of dusty cocoa and caramel malt, followed by medium toasted grain, leather and grassiness. Excellent nose, true to style and enticing. The flavor introduces additions of pepper and pear. Toastiness mostly covers bitterness and meshes well with caramel malt. Light chocolate and spice in the flavor. Finishes soft, lightly bitter, dusty. Mouthfeel is adequately carbonated and just shy of medium bodied, lightly prickly. Satisfying.

Pours relatively clear, maroon red, with a medium off white head.  Smells of toasted malts, caramel, and dark fruits.  Kind of warm and roasty smelling.  Nice flavor, sweet malts, caramel, a little roast.  Slight bitterness was masked quite nicely by the sweetness.  Balanced pretty well.  The finish is sweet with a somewhat dry mouthfeel.  The aftertaste is of caramel malts.  Not a bad dunkel.
A very well beer, lots of malty taste, maybe to sweet? Malty, bread,  roasted chocolate, caramel.
Tap at Andechs near the Munich Dom 0.5ltr: Not so good as his Helles brother. Amber coloured beer with roasted malts taste.
Amber color with a fast disappearing white head. Malty caramel aroma. Metallic & malty flavor. A lot of corn also. No lacings.  Light to thin body. Not impressed!
Pours a copper colour, quite pale for a dunkel (at least in my expieriance). A sweet aroma but an almost salty, quite smokey flavour. Quite different from any other beer Ive tried.

Bottled (thanks DerDoppelbock). Amberish brown colour with small beige head. Aroma is sweet malts, along with some fudge and fruits Flavour is roasted malts, some sweet candyish notes as well as a caramelly note in the background.
(50 cl bottle) Clear brown color, tan head. Sweet malty scent, slightly fruity. Roasted malt and fruity taste. Medium mouthfeel and bitterness.
Nose is cocoa, dark fruits, rich caramel, kinda thomas-hardys esque.  Flavor is cocoa & caramel, a hint of bitterness.

Bottle. Thanks for sharing Chris! Aroma percolate of soft, supple caramel and toaste german malts. Plenty of earthy sugars, yet subdued in a lager fashion. Sweet. Clear mahogany with gold edges and a rim of off-white. A well, attenuated dunkel, brimming with woody grain sugars, baked cookies, light chocolates and toothy candy. A bit of peaches, plums and sweet sheeting. Theres some sense of flavor reduction through heavy filtering.
Bottle. Small white head. Clear red brown body. Caramel honey aroma. Thin caramel hops flavor. Heavily carboneted. Short hops aftertaste.
Bottle - Beertasting at work. Clear dark amber - offwhite head. Malty, bread, ryebread, roasted, berries, chokolate, caramel, light licorice. A bit too weak.

[bottle]
Toasted malt aroma with a touch of butterscotch and some floral hops.  Some tobacco/raisin in there as well.  Clear, darkish amber with a lasting, off-white cover that left little patches of foam on the walls.  Nice toasty flavour reminiscent of an altbier, but with a bit more nutty.  Subdued hops in the flavour, which I like in this style.  Light to medium body with medium carbonation and a nuttly finish.
Bottle.  Reddish brown beer with  a strong head.  The aroma is malty and coffee, and the flavour is bitter, malty and slightly roasted dry.  Overall an average beer.
UPDATED: JUL 29, 2007 Bottle. Ruby colour, medium off-white head. Roasted and nutty malt aroma. Medium bodied. Nicely balanced, with a light bitterness in the finish.

UPDATED: NOV 14, 2007 Bottled. A clear red/brown beer with a medium sized and persistent beige head. the aroma is malty, nutty and caramellish with toasted notes and some herbal hops. The flavour is quite powerful and very malty. There are the usual notes of nut, caramel and toasted bread, perfectly balanced by a more than decent herbal hoppiness in the final. medium body, but fuller than I first remebered, average to lively carbonation, very little acidity, quite long aftertaste. The bitterness is higher than your average dunkel. Probably the best beer I have tried in this style together with the Ayingers one. An excellent beer, has all you can ask in a dunkel.

Bottle. Brown color with a large creamy good lacing off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, roasted, caramel. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and moderate bitter with a average to long duration. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. A rather good, and refreshing, dunkel.

Bottled(500ml). -Reddish brown coloured, medium sized beige head, mild roasted malt nose. Bitter roasted aroma of malts and hops with notes of nuts and smoke. Some weak caramel notes in the finish. In comparison with Doppelbock Dunkel quite weak and watery.
Brick red, verging on brown.  Frothy head.  Very appetizing to look at.  Roasty, sweet aroma.  Milk chocolate sweetness.  Flavor passed too quickly.  All that was left to do was drink more.
Bottle: Poured reddish brown with frothy biege head. Sweet rich dark malt aroma. Rich sweet roasted malt flavor.

500ml bottle from Beers of Europe.  Reddish brown colour, with a bronze glow. Thin beige head. Bready malt and chocolate on the nose, with a touch of sour fruit. The flavour is much the same as the aroma, although with less chocolate in evidence. Dabs of liquorice and nice bitter bite on the finish. Quite light bodied, with a distinct prickle in the mouth and a tart, acidic edge. Perhaps a touch carbonic. A rather good, and refreshing, dunkel.
Bottle. Nice head with medium duration. Color is dark brown. Aroma is roast malt. Taste is caramel with a roast malt finish.

Bottle. Pours dark brown with mostly diminishing light brown head. Burnt malt and caramel in the aroma. Flavor offers malt, hops and a profound cask wood note. Rather creamy on the palate. Average finish with some spiciness. Well made Dunkel.
Clear dark amber color with great head. Clear burnt flavor with a hint of liquorice a truly great Dunkel but only 4,9%.

Bottle: Reddish-amber coloured, medium-sized fluffy off-white head, quickly diminishing; sweet, dark-malty nose with a tinge of molasses and some fruitiness; sweetish flavour with the faintest idea of bitterness, medium bodied; sweet-fruity and malty finish. A pleasant, well rounded brew, but nothing spectacular.......

On tap at GBBF 06, 10 fl oz. Dark brown beer with thick head. Sweet fruity silky smooth beer with a heavy chocolated malt. Some burnt, roasted woody notes. Lacks a finish, being a little thin on the tongue at the end and retains a CO2 taste. A reasonable if unspectacular beer.

Bottle from Germany.  Translucent cherry-lacquered brown in color with a dense, spongy, 3/4" tan head riding on top for the duration of the beer.  Aroma is delicately composed of french silk pie with chocolate graham crust, stark chocolate toffee, flame licked tree bark, and turtle fudge frozen custard.  Flavor chimes in as lighter fairing.  Cocoa dusted, crushed graham crackers.  Silky chocolate trait folds back the fragile flavor layers.  Liquefied chocolate wafers emit a vibe akin to a touch of room temp hot chocolate, cooled at its warmest state with an ice cube or two and dulled it down by doing so.  Mildly roasted accents with circumstantial caramel drizzles.  Errs on the light side, gently tossing over the tongue with a moments respite at more concrete semi-chocolate characteristics.  A mild chocolate butterscotch generality gently weaves in and out as we go along.  Light french silk custard comes out again the finish, coupling with a eased mocha torte airiness.
On tap at Andechs monastery, nr Munich. Smooth, cereal, choc Dunkel. Nice stuff, easily swiggable and sweet. Provides a nice hit.
Dark amber with fizzy light tanned pour. Sweet, rich aroma of juicy malt, dark caramel. A bit to dry up front with strong carbonation followed by woody-caramel finish. Aroma promised much more.
(Tap) Had at the International Beer Fest in Hamburg, Germany. Pours dark brown with beige head. Good flavoring includes roasted caramel and coffee. All in all, a nice dunkel.

Bottle. Creamy white excellent fully lasting head. Amber colour. Very nice looking beer. Week but nice malty aroma.
Elegant flavor but not so powerfull. Oily palate. Well balanced but a bit anonymous beer.

Bottled.  Pale mahogany pour with a staunch beige head.  Chocolatey aroma with some toasted malt, nutty with some caramel.  Full-flavored!  Velvety smooth with the same flavor as in the nose, caramel strengthens.  Splash of sweetness.  As a minus, a bit thin, but thats really the style, isnt it?  Lasting smooth, toasty, dry finish.  Superb Dunkel, perhaps the most pleasant drinking experience Ive had this week.

(bottle) Clear ruby brown coloured and slightly effervescent hue with a nice foamy tanned head with slow lacing. Decent toastmalty aroma with bread crusts, chocolate and caramel. Mild bitter flavour, medium body, well-carbonated smooth mouthfeel. Moderate sweet toastmalty taste with caramel, chocolate and light fruity notes of dark berries; balanced medium sweet malty and spicy bitter hoppy finish with liquorice.
bottle bbd. 22 mar. 2006. great dunkel. roasted malt, caramel and a bit fruity taste. smells caramelish. finishes sweet and bitter. good balanced palate. very drinkable...
This is a very good Dunkel. Powerful aroma and taste. Nice palate and lasting taste. If you can find it, buy it!

A nice dunkel, ruby pour, nice head, abit of roasted flavor, with a hint of sourness on the tongue, very fresh taste to this one, as usually the case with the andechser I get locally, another solid beer from Andechser.
Bottle. Mild, roasted aroma. Clear brown colour, stable head. Flavour is mildly roasted with a little coffee and some horse flavour.

Rating #1350. Bottle from Beers of Europe. Pours a clear brown. Aroma is a one dimensional caramel malt and not much else. To taste this is thin, sweet malt and lots of caramel. There is a burnt sugar aftertaste that I dont like. Very one dimensional and verging on unpleasent. Worst offering from the brewery.

Just tried a 500ml bottle one month past its best before date, this wasnt a good idea. DONT GO THERE! It was terrible - a sweet syrupy sickly taste, yuck. I dont know whether it should improve with age or not, as my knowledge of German beer is limited, is it a top or bottom fermenter? Therefore my ratings may not be fair/justified. Some comments would be appreciated.

500 ml bottle: Poured cola brown with a medium beige head. A little cooler than room temperature. Light roasted malt aroma with a touch of Worchestershire sauce. A little meaty in other words. Flavor is light roasted malt. Very slight sweetness in the finish with a touch of bitterness. A nice Dunkel.
From tap at the Andechs Klosterbrauerei in Germany.  This is the best Dunkels Ive ever had.  A great pairing to the Schweinshaxen and Sauerkraut I had on the occassion.

Another dunkel for me to sample. Aroma is smokey malts going to roasted with a great sweetness as it warms a little. Taste is great, malty dough to start with, however soon turns to a rich roasted malty sweetness with soem sort of juiceyness kickin in as it warms. Excellent, would love to spend a nite on this fellow.

500 ml bottle, bought in Bier Spezi Hamburg. ABV is 4.9%. Typical dunkel clear reddish brown colour, very good and lingering light tan head. Very nice aroma of moderately roasted malts, flaked nuts, caramel and bakery. Flavour is malty and nutty with notes of dark bread and caramel, not too sweet. German dunkels are not "big" beers, but are, when well made, a truly enjoyable drinking experience. This is one of them.
Bottle from Beers of Europe. Orangey brown with persistant head. Aroma of bready malt with caramel, nut and a distinct smoke note. Firm mouthfeel, slightly sweet, soft malty finish. Very good.
This is best dunkel beer I have ever tasted.  Great flavor that can not be forgetten.  It is not overpowering on the alcohol content.  The palate can not be satisfied with just one mug.

Bottle, at home.
Dark red with off-white head, mostly lasting, fair lacings. Aroma moderate/heavy malty (roasted, bread), light hoppy. Flavor moderate sweet, light bitter, average duration. Light body, watery, lively carbonated.

#1500, bottled. One of the better dunkels around according to rating. However, i was not impressed by this one. Sharp aroma of roasted malt, german hops, quite one-dimensional. Taste is better, roasted malty, some wheat, bit dry. Sticky palate.
Very roasted malts in the nose. Clear, brown-red coloured with a brown, thin head. Taste is sweet, very roasted malty. Bit dry, bit sharp. Not really impressive.
Malty and roasted taste. Bitter palate. Sticky palate. Its a nice taste. Taste becomes better along the way.

(Bottle 50 cl) Dark brown but far from black, with a lovely big and brownish head. Very malty and roasted, but not ashy dry - more caramelish and sweet. Extremely high gravity - you would expect this to be stronger than it actually is. 081000
Malt aroma in the pour.  Raisin brown color with a tan head.  Carbonation is light, small bubbles.  Bready malt sweetness up front and through most of the finish.  A very good dunkel.
Bottle. Low carbonation, almost too malty, sweet, caramel, raisins, finish achieves some measure of balance but im still only having one at a time...

Reddish brown with big firm white foam. Deep amlty aroma of toffee, almond, toasted bread, burnt sugar and grass. Wonderfull and deep malty flavour of light chocolate, fresh baked ryebread, raisinbread and toffee. Extremely well-balanced aftertaste of roasted malt, toffee and nuts. This is an awesome dunkel!

From A Bottle.Auburn in colour with a small head,aroma is of dark malt,
taste is malty with some sweetness and nuts.

Bottled.  Quite reddish for a dunkel but otherwise mostly brown.  The aroma is dusty chocolate with sweet caramel notes and malty fruits.  The taste is full-bodied; sweet and smoky with lots of fruity malts and brown bread.  A very nice dunkel which is to be expected when you consider how good the Doppelbock is.  World class in its field.

This comes my way thanks to Madsberg!
A light brown creamy head topped this marvelous brew. The head lasted all the way so I had to look through the side of the glass to see the sparkling clear body of mahogany brown with ruby edges.
Heavy, malty aroma with bread and toast coming through.
The flavor was lightly sweet and delivered with a creamy softness. Very enjoyable Dunkel.
clear ruby-brown colour, little chaotic foam, toasted malty aroma with notes of butter and nuts, light to medium body, sweet, malty and slightly dry toasted finish

Draught at Cetimeter III, Vienna
Malty sweet aroma. Nice creamy brown head, dark brown color. Taste is malty, light sweet, fresh. Notes of burnt malt, especially in the dry bitter aftertaste.  Not bad, but not my cup of tea.

Tap.  Good deep amber to slightly brown and pretty clear.  Good lasting head although small.  Aroma is sweet and malty from munich malts.  No hops in the aroma but they come out slightly in the flavor it balance it out.  Seems a slight bit fuller in body that many other dunkels despite its average abv.  Good all around dunkel.

Bottle.  Sweet dark chocolate malt aroma with hints of hops and ester.  Dark amber color with small head.  Sweet malt initially with tart-estery finish.  Moderate body.  Closer in flavor to a bock than most dunkels
Dark amber colour. Good mix of fruit and malt in the aroma, very fresh taste for a Dunkel - I found a lot of apple in the flavour. Refreshing, if a bit thin.
Amber color, light sweet malty light roasted aroma and taste, light thin body, light sweet finish.

Strongly nutty aroma. Amber colored with little beige head. Rich aroma with roasted malt and some chocolate too, excellent one. Flavor has also strong nutty tone, roasted coffee comes up later. Medium bodied with some carbonation, finely balanced dunkel.

Tap, at Café Abseits in Bamberg. Deep chestnut red, thin white head and moderate condition. Sweet and malty aroma with traces of roast barley. Sweet and full in the mouth with plenty of malt and some low roast barley, almost bordering on a barley wine at times. Sweet lingering malt with some solid hop bitterness in the finish.
Half a year too old. Aroma full of malt. Colour is dark brown, head light brown. Flavor has the malt too, but the age of this beer has perhaps made the flavor a little odd.

UPDATED: AUG 2, 2011 Roasted malts and light fieldberries are swung into an earthy hop bitterness, working nicely with the drying effect of the roastiness in the finish...Some tartness acccompanies the lean fruitiness, which isnt necessary imho...

Lightly roasty but generally sweet malty aroma with plenty of fruity esters (dates, berries, figs).Beautiful on first pour but head dies quickly. Clear amber-brown with off-white head that diminishes completely. Roasted malts and a fair bitterness are off-set by a surprising fruitiness. Body is quite light and carbonation is rather low. Roastiness and fruitiness both seem out of place in a dunkel to me, though this is quite tasty. Bottle enjoyed with MartinT and Rastacouere.

Burgundy to orange coloured. Light 1cm off-white head. Tiny bubbles. Quite the truckload of malt in there! The lager light weight fights to offer more flavours than it has and almost succeeds. This is almost smoky, almost spicy, almost fruity. Almost hard to describe actually since unexpected flavours tha shouldnt necessarily be found in a dunkel seem to come up every sip. Blue grapes hints, berries etc.. Malt seems powdery to me on the tongue. Pleasant roastiness, cerealic, flake-like. Fairly long malty finish. Great flavour balance. Excellent light body, moderately high carbonation.
On draft at the brewery July 2003.  Another 1 liter stein - the best way to drink german draft beer.  Dry yet full to the palate, a hint of nuts.  Crisp finish that beckons you to take another gulp.

Dark reddish brown with a large, quickly disappearing head.  Aromas are smooth chocolate malts with floral hops.  Flavours are more floral than expected with some chocolate malts, nuttiness and sweet roast character.  Not quite as malty as I was expecting but still very nice.

Given to me by a co-worker who recently went to Germany. Pours a clear dark reddish brown with an off-white head. Aroma is lightly malty and reminiscent of smoked beef jerky. Taste is sweet, malty, roasty with a nutty molasses character and a hint of sourness/roastinesss.Mouthfeel is full and round. Recommended.

I must say that everyone I drank with the night I tried this brew disagreed with me wholeheartedly. I found the nose to be overly yeasty wih a foot-like scent. Medium-bodied, I also felt like there was too much breadiness to the malty middle, and not enough hop character. Not enough roastiness for the style.
Coffee and malt aroma and falvor. Caramel. Sweetish with just a bit of roasted malt. Medium bodied. Great quality dunkel, one of my favorites!
Lots of rich malt, with carmel and bread tones. Balaced by some light hopps. very smooth, tones of prune and raisin. delicious.
Amber color. Quite ordinary Dunkel, with loads of caramel, but at least also some malty structure.
Very nice copper colour with small head. Aroma is sweet with some caramel. Flavor is also sweet, and has roasted touch.

Bottled.
Nutbrown with an ok head.
A sweetish toffee-aroma.
A bit thin and dry palate.
Smoky and burnt flavour.

Bottled. 
Clear copper colour. Aroma of toffee and malt. Quite rich toffee flavour with a clear maltiness. Somewhat smokey.
Quite distinguish roasted and burned malty feeling. Nice and smooth. Very tasty. I like it, even though Jens likes the Weihenstephaner better.
(tap at the monastery) deep brown with good head. Lovely caramel malt--bready and nutty.
A very classic Dunkel. Brown coloured. Malty and slightly bready. Notes of smoke.
bottle version; nice dark brown; smell of malt and caramel; rich body; slightly sweet taste

a good medium bodied beer that pours a thick head.Some fruitness and nuts are detected.The finish was clean but it did leave me thirsty like i had too much salt.I dont know maybe its me.Overall it was real good

On tap, at Andechs monastery restaurant. Brown coloured, off-white head, mostly lasting, glass sticking. Soft malt aroma (bread, toasty, nutty, wild flower honey), very light hoppy. Very smooth in taste, full body, velvety texture in the mouth.

Oooh, this is nice. Bread dough, with some caramel and  some nuttyness in the nose. Really soft and full mouthfeel. The balance is amazing. Nicely nutty and bready, some drying hops towards the finish isa touch grassy/herbal, medium bitterness, beautiful.
A deep red beer with a good head. The aroma is slightly fruity and sweet with notes of brewmash. The flavor is of brewmash, sweetness, and slightly sour. A little thin.
Bottled at the Danish Beerfestival 2003: Red/brown coloured. Off white head. Malts, fruits and spices in the nose. Flavour is malty and has light notes of chocolate/cocoa. Light bitter in the end.

deepbrown, frothy tan head.lot of malt in the nose.
 deep malty taste with notesof caramel,chocolateand brown sugar.  
essentiallyalesspotent versionof thedoppelbock and just as tasty.

Basically a lighter version of the doppel dunkel.
Fruity, spicy taste, slightly yeasty.
Bitterhop finish.

very yeasty aroma - white bread dough. light dunkel. plenty of malt but not of the dark kind. pretty luscious stuff - the only thing that tastes like vegemite toast that i like, including vegemite toast

UPDATED: DEC 1, 2007 Bottle (BB Jun 08). Head is initially average sized, frothy, light brown, mostly lasting. Body is clear medium to dark brown. Aroma is moderately malty (caramel, toasted bread, nuts), lightly hoppy (flowers, herbs), with notes of orange peel and toffee. Flavor is moderately sweet, lightly to moderately bitter. Finish is lightly sweet, moderately bitter. Light to medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation. Light and watery in the mouth, and not all that flavorful, but the aroma is quite nice for the style.  Not the 5.0 I thought it was many years ago, but thats how it goes.

Dark copper color. Decent creamy head. Acid malty aroma. Flavour starts sweet malty, continues with distinct roasted malt flavours. Finishes hoppy dry. Aftertaste first herbal, later malty, grainy and slightly sour. Quality of malt is dissappointing. Overall too sweet for being nicely drinkable.

Smells like malt extract - full, sweet nose. Caramel brown color and a fluffy tan head. Chocolate and malty tones in the taste, slight bitter tang at the end. Medium body, creamy mouth feel. Good balance. Classy beer.
Very malty also hoppy, grainy aroma. Great big hazelnut brown frothy head on the amber body. Malty but not sweet. Woody notes. Fullmouth and just yummie!
Not as good as I expected. Dark brown/ruby with malt aroma.  Very clean malt taste, but not the level of maltiness I expected from this great brewery.
Pale brown. malty, nutty, full flavoured and superbly balanced. The best dunkel Ive tried.
Nice Palate - nice aroma - and a very dark vitamin b kind of taste - very good
